column4: Cucumber is considered as a fruit or vegetable?
column10: Cucumber is a widely cultivated plant in the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae. It is a creeping vine that bears cylindrical fruits that bears cylindrical fruits that are used culinary vegetables. There are three main varieties of cucumber: slicing, pickling, and burpless.

column4: Which country is the largest producer of carrots?
column10: China is Carrot production King of the World , the US ranks among the other top nations in the production of carrots: fourth in acreage and volume, third in terms of yield (31.7 tons/ha). Russia, Japan, France and the United Kingdom are also leading producers.

Beetroot is a naturally occurring root vegetable that is commonly found in the temperate and tropical regions. It is also extremely low in calories, specifically 36 calories per 100 gm of beet. Beetroot juice is also similarly replete with health boosting compounds and is ideal for diabetes. Beet root juice has a detoxifying effect on the body.

column4: Which of the following vegetables is considered as a leafy vegetables?
column10: Cabbage is a leafy green or purple biennial plant, grown as an annual vegetable crop for its dense-leaved heads. Closely related to other cole crops such as broccoli, cauliflower, and brussels sprouts, it descends from a wild field cabbage.

Okra or Okro Abelmoschus esculentus, known in many English-speaking countries as ladies fingers is a flowering plant in the mallow family. It is valued for its edible green seed pods. The geographical origin of okra is disputed, with supporters of West African, Ethiopian and South Asian origins.
